title: Event transcript during tests shows "<indexed>" property instead of event value
body:
## Issue

When a test fails and I am shown the emitted events from the execution, if an event value was declared as _indexed_, I will be shown the string "<indexed>" instead of the value of my event.

## Steps to Reproduce

Example from IERC20:
```
event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value);

...
function _transfer(address from, address to, uint256 value) internal {
        require(to != address(0));

        _balances[from] = _balances[from].sub(value);
        _balances[to] = _balances[to].add(value);
        emit Transfer(from, to, value);
    }
```

I then call the transfer() function during a truffle test that fails, i.e. because the expected number is not correct:

```

await TokenInterface.transfer(testAddress, 5)
		
assert.deepEqual(
	(await TokenInterface.balanceOf(coinbase)).toNumber(),
	1000
)
```
## Expected Behavior

I would expect the output to look like this:

```
Events emitted during test:
    ---------------------------

    Transfer(from: 0x024269E2057b904d1Fa6a7B52056A8580a85180F, to: 0x7EF5A6135f1FD6a02593eEdC869c6D41D934aef8, value: 5)

    ---------------------------
```

## Actual Results

What I get is this:
```
Events emitted during test:
    ---------------------------

    Transfer(from: <indexed>, to: <indexed>, value: 5)

    ---------------------------
```

## Environment

* Operating System: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6
* Ethereum client: geth 1.8.22-stable
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): Truffle v5.0.4
* node version (`node --version`): v10.7.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.5.0
